wikipedia_page.main: James Harwood Panting (1854 - 1924) was a British writer who specialised in school stories for boys. He was the editor of Young Folks and a member of the editorial staff of the South London Press.

response: Phyllis Panting was the daughter of James Harwood Panting, a writer of school stories for boys, and Bertha Emily Panting. She was born in Brixton, London, in 1901 where she lived at the family home of 47 Beechdale, Brixton Hill with her parents, her sister Ruth and her brothers Ray and Arnold.1911 England, Wales & Scotland Census Transcription. findmypast.co.uk Retrieved 19 November 2014.  Panting was educated at St Paul's Girls' School, and her early career was in the BBC drama department where she wrote scripts and acted. She was a member of the London Radio Repertory Players in the 1920s.Loyalty. Genome BETA Radio Times 1923 - 2009. Retrieved 17 November 2014. By the late 1920s Panting was in journalism and editor of the children's paper My Favourite.
